intro: Seruneum pedunculatum, commonly known as the silverleaf bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pale blue, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
